page.title: 13FARMING METHODS, HOLBERROW
page.content: Approximately 10 of the farms in the area are working. Of those more are owned than worked by tenant farmers, the majority by families who occasionally employ a farm worker often on dairy farms where a relief milker is a necessity. The present day trend indicates that the farm may not necessarily be inherited by the children. Most farmers are connected to the National Farmers Union. Mechanical farm machinery varies but includes tractors, balers (for both oblong and the modern round bale), numerous ploughs, drills and grain dryers. Some farmers do contract work for others in the area, few own such large equipment as combine harvesters and these are usually hired at harvest time. An inherited knowledge is used to repair machinery and farmers keep a variety of medication for emergencies.
